div.head: Edward Roberts Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. I Edward Roberts of Charles County in the
province of Maryland being sick in body in perfect sense and memory
thanks to Almighty God do ordaine and make this my last will and
testament in presense of followeth first I beque my soule to god hoping through
his blessed Death and passion that he will have mercy upon my soule and
Receive me into his heavenly kingdom and what small estate that that god
has been pleased to bestow apon me I am willing it should be dispersed
as foleth I give and beque all my astate both reall and parsonall unto unto
Charles Allenson and Elizabeth Allenson son and Daughter to Thomas Allenson
of Charles County in the province of Maryland and the said Tho. Allenson
father to the said Charles Allenson and Elizabeth to be hole and sole Executor
of this my lasy will and testament in the said children behalf or any
money that is folen to me in England by the Death of an unhell John
Rud sun to my grand Father George unintellegable as by the said
grand father will will apear and I do further ordaine this my last
will and testament trusting and making voyd all former wills by me
mad and for this my last will and testament to I hope in my mercy of god
that he will arrive- my soule and for the have performance I have hearunto
set my hand and seal this fifteen day of January 1676.

Signed Sealed and Delivered
In the presence of us
his
John Belley
his
Martha W Browne
mark
William Boyne
Edward Roberts

On the back of the foregoing will was the following probate Endorsed (to will)
November 22d. 1677.

The deposition of William Boydon and John Belley saith that this is the
last will and testament of Edward Roberts of Charles County desed
and was his oath and deed and further saith noth sworn before me
Zachary Wade as it doth appear by my hand and seal
3 1/4 sides
Zachary Wade
